column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=An afterlife ?
#Text=I do n't know if it 's in those terms , exactly , but there are a lot of things we do n't understand .
#Text=We 're all part of the same thing .

#Text=For various Gnostic reasons , saying that there 's this thing that existed before all of us , that we 're all part of it , and that each of us is made up of a piece of this thing -- it 's appealing to me .
#Text=What 's a trait you deplore in yourself ?
#Text=The trait I hate most in myself is probably one of my best traits --
#Text=Is n't that always the case ?
#Text=Yeah , probably .
#Text=Probably .
#Text=I 've always been loyal to people , and I think it 's one of my worst and best traits .
#Text=How is it your best trait ?
#Text=I stand behind people who are really quite troubled and messed up . [ laughs nervously ]
#Text=Is that also how it 's one of your worst , then ?
#Text=Yeah , yeah .
#Text=Image : David Shankbone .
#Text=What ’s a time that this trait screwed you over .

#Text=As a young writer , I knew a lot of extremely talented , amazing people who were hell-bent on self-destruction , as are a lot of people at that age who are creative people , and yet I still believed in them .
#Text=How so ?
#Text=Typical drug , alcohol problems , or --
#Text=Yeah , or just really self-sabotaging .
#Text=A novelist , let 's say , who refused to finish the novel and kept rewriting until it was ruined .
#Text=Or an artist who --
#Text=Like Joseph Grand in The Plague where he was rewriting the same sentence over and over ?
#Text=Yeah , yeah , or just doing a gigantic revision when it was really finished , or an artist who was doing quite well and then started dating their art dealer and cheated on them .
#Text=People have all kinds of ways of destroying themselves .
#Text=What do you think it is that drives many artists to sink their own ships ?
#Text=Well , because partially , I think the inclination to be a creative person is to blow things up , right ?
#Text=And of course the nearest thing around you is yourself .
#Text=Do you think that Norman Rockwell had that inclination ?
#Text=I do n't know his history that well .
#Text=Did he ?
#Text=I do n't know , either .
#Text=No by his popular image .
#Text=There 's also a lot of bullshit in our culture , which pushes the idea that to be a successful artist you have to be utterly self-destructive .
#Text=What 's your most treasured possession ?
#Text=You ca n't include kids , because they 're not really possessions .
#Text=My most treasured possession ?
#Text=Well -- I like this painting right here .
#Text=Is it your most treasured ?
